Class CommandProcessor

  • java.lang.Object
    • CommandProcessor

  • public class CommandProcessor
extends java.lang.Object

    CommandProcessor

    The CommandProcessor Class is the main workhorse of our application. It takes a command inputted at the console, parses it, and passes it to the relevant AlphaZ function. It also maintains internal state to maintain local variables, print command history, print help, and undo/redo an action.
    Author:
    Hrishikesh Vaidya, Surya Teja Chavali, B Akilesh

        CommandProcessor()

        The constructor of the CommandProcessor class. Generates the mapping of AlphaZ functions to return types, and also initializes internal state variables.

    • Method Detail

      • computeFunc

        public void computeFunc(java.lang.String input)
                 throws java.lang.ClassNotFoundException,
                        java.lang.NoSuchMethodException,
                        java.lang.SecurityException,
                        java.lang.IllegalAccessException,
                        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                        java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException,
                        java.io.IOException

        computeFunc

        The main workhorse of the CommandProcessor class. Reads the command, obtains the parameters, passes it to the relevant overloaded (usually AlphaZ) method. If there is an error, prints the relevant help message, indicating usage.
        Parameters:
        input - The command
        Throws:
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
        java.lang.NoSuchMethodException
        java.lang.SecurityException
        java.lang.IllegalAccessException
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException
        java.io.IOException
